event.descr:
The disassociate notification shall be sent when the Station sends a Disassociation frame. The value of the notification shall include the MAC address of the MAC to which the Disassociation frame was sent and the reason for the disassociation

bsnStationAPMacAddr %parm[#3]%;

bsnStationAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnStationReasonCode %parm[#5]%; unspecified(1) previousAuthNotValid(2) deauthenticationLeaving(3) disassociationDueToInactivity(4) disassociationAPBusy(5) class2FrameFromNonAuthStation(6) class2FrameFromNonAssStation(7) disassociationStaHasLeft(8) staReqAssociationWithoutAuth(9) missingReasonCode(99)

bsnStationMacAddress %parm[#6]%;
event.logmsg: bsnDot11StationDisassociate trap received bsnStationAPMacAddr=%parm[#3]% bsnStationAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnStationReasonCode=%parm[#5]% bsnStationMacAddress=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
The deauthenticate notification shall be sent when the Station sends a Deauthentication frame. The value of the notification shall include the MAC address of the MAC to which the Deauthentication frame was sent and the reason for the deauthentication.

bsnStationAPMacAddr %parm[#3]%;

bsnStationAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnStationReasonCode %parm[#5]%; unspecified(1) previousAuthNotValid(2) deauthenticationLeaving(3) disassociationDueToInactivity(4) disassociationAPBusy(5) class2FrameFromNonAuthStation(6) class2FrameFromNonAssStation(7) disassociationStaHasLeft(8) staReqAssociationWithoutAuth(9) missingReasonCode(99)

bsnStationMacAddress %parm[#6]%;
event.logmsg: bsnDot11StationDeauthenticate trap received bsnStationAPMacAddr=%parm[#3]% bsnStationAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnStationReasonCode=%parm[#5]% bsnStationMacAddress=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
The authenticate failure notification shall be sent when the Station sends an Authentication frame with a status code other than 'successful'. The value of the notification shall include the MAC address of the MAC to which the Authentication frame was sent and the reason for the authentication failure.

bsnStationAPMacAddr %parm[#3]%;

bsnStationAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnStationReasonCode %parm[#5]%; unspecified(1) previousAuthNotValid(2) deauthenticationLeaving(3) disassociationDueToInactivity(4) disassociationAPBusy(5) class2FrameFromNonAuthStation(6) class2FrameFromNonAssStation(7) disassociationStaHasLeft(8) staReqAssociationWithoutAuth(9) missingReasonCode(99)

bsnStationMacAddress %parm[#6]%;
event.logmsg: bsnDot11StationAuthenticateFail trap received bsnStationAPMacAddr=%parm[#3]% bsnStationAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnStationReasonCode=%parm[#5]% bsnStationMacAddress=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
The associate failure notification shall be sent when the Station sends an Association frame with a status code other than 'successful'. The value of the notification shall include the MAC address of the MAC to which the Authentication frame was sent and the reason for the authentication failure.

bsnStationAPMacAddr %parm[#3]%;

bsnStationAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnStationReasonCode %parm[#5]%; unspecified(1) previousAuthNotValid(2) deauthenticationLeaving(3) disassociationDueToInactivity(4) disassociationAPBusy(5) class2FrameFromNonAuthStation(6) class2FrameFromNonAssStation(7) disassociationStaHasLeft(8) staReqAssociationWithoutAuth(9) missingReasonCode(99)

bsnStationMacAddress %parm[#6]%;
event.logmsg: bsnDot11StationAssociateFail trap received bsnStationAPMacAddr=%parm[#3]% bsnStationAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnStationReasonCode=%parm[#5]% bsnStationMacAddress=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
When Airespace AP operation status goes up this trap will be sent

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

When Airespace AP operation status goes down this trap will be sent

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

When Airespace AP Associates to a Airespace Switch, AP associated notification will be sent with dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP.This will help management system to discover Airespace AP and add to system.

bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPPortNumberTrapVariable %parm[#4]%;

When Airespace AP disassociates from Airespace Switch, AP disassociated notification will be sent with dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP management system to remove Airespace AP from this Airespace Switch

bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable %parm[#3]%;

When Airespace AP's interface's operation status goes up this trap will be sent

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPPortNumber %parm[#5]%;

bsnAPIfUpDownCause %parm[#6]%; unknown(0) radioFailure(1) radioLowPower(2) maxRetransmission(3) echoTimeout(4) configAP(5) configRadio(6) configNetwork(7)
event.logmsg: bsnAPIfUp trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnAPPortNumber=%parm[#5]% bsnAPIfUpDownCause=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
When Airespace AP's interface's operation status goes down this trap will be sent.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPAdminStatus %parm[#5]%; enable(1) disable(2)

bsnAPIfAdminStatus %parm[#6]%; enable(1) disable(2)

bsnAPIfUpDownCause %parm[#7]%; unknown(0) radioFailure(1) radioLowPower(2) maxRetransmission(3) echoTimeout(4) configAP(5) configRadio(6) configNetwork(7)
event.logmsg: bsnAPIfDown trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnAPAdminStatus=%parm[#5]% bsnAPIfAdminStatus=%parm[#6]% bsnAPIfUpDownCause=%parm[#7]%

event.descr:
When LOAD Profile state changes from PASS to FAIL, notification will be sent with Dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP and slot ID of Airespace AP IF. This trap sending can be enable/disable using bsnRrmProfileTrapControlFlag

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

When Noise Profile state changes from PASS to FAIL, notification will be sent with Dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP and slot ID of Airespace AP IF. This trap sending can be enable/disable using bsnRrmProfileTrapControlFlag

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

When Interference Profile state changes from PASS to FAIL, notification will be sent with Dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP and slot ID of Airespace AP IF. This trap sending can be enable /disable using bsnRrmProfileTrapControlFlag

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

When Coverage Profile state changes from PASS to FAIL, notification will be sent with Dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP and slot ID of Airespace AP IF. This trap sending can be enable/disable using bsnRrmProfileTrapControlFlag

bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPNameTrapVariable %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPSlotIdTrapVariable %parm[#5]%;

bsnAPCoverageThresholdTrapVariable %parm[#6]%;

bsnAPCoverageFailedClients %parm[#7]%;

bsnAPCoverageTotalClients %parm[#8]%;

bsnClientMacAddr %parm[#9]%;

bsnClientRssi %parm[#10]%;

bsnClientSnr %parm[#11]%;
event.logmsg: bsnAPCoverageProfileFailed trap received bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable=%parm[#3]% bsnAPNameTrapVariable=%parm[#4]% bsnAPSlotIdTrapVariable=%parm[#5]% bsnAPCoverageThresholdTrapVariable=%parm[#6]% bsnAPCoverageFailedClients=%parm[#7]% bsnAPCoverageTotalClients=%parm[#8]% bsnClientMacAddr=%parm[#9]% bsnClientRssi=%parm[#10]% bsnClientSnr=%parm[#11]%

event.descr:
When Coverage Profile state changes from PASS to FAIL, notification will be sent with Dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP and slot ID of Airespace AP IF. This trap sending can be enable/disable using bsnRrmProfileTrapControlFlag

bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPNameTrapVariable %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPSlotIdTrapVariable %parm[#5]%;

bsnAPCoverageThresholdTrapVariable %parm[#6]%;

bsnAPCoverageFailedClients %parm[#7]%;

bsnAPCoverageTotalClients %parm[#8]%;

bsnClientMacAddr %parm[#9]%;

bsnClientRssi %parm[#10]%;

bsnClientSnr %parm[#11]%;

event.descr:
When Coverage Profile state changes from PASS to FAIL, notification will be sent with Dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP and slot ID of Airespace AP IF. This trap sending can be enable/disable using bsnRrmProfileTrapControlFlag

bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPNameTrapVariable %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPSlotIdTrapVariable %parm[#5]%;

bsnAPCoverageThresholdTrapVariable %parm[#6]%;

bsnAPCoverageFailedClients %parm[#7]%;

bsnAPCoverageTotalClients %parm[#8]%;

bsnClientMacAddr %parm[#9]%;

bsnClientRssi %parm[#10]%;

bsnClientSnr %parm[#11]%;

event.descr:
Whenever dynamic algorithms are running and bsnAPIfPhyPowerAutomaticOn is true , Airespace AP Interface's CurrentTxPower might get updated by algorithm. When this occurs notification will be sent with Dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP and slot ID of Airespace AP IF along with the currentTxPower for this Airespace AP IF

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPIfPhyTxPowerLevel %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: bsnAPCurrentTxPowerChanged trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnAPIfPhyTxPowerLevel=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
Whenever dynamic algorithms are running and bsnAPIfPhyChannelAutomaticOn is true , Airespace AP Interface's CurrentChannel might get updated by algorithm. When this occurs notification will be sent with Dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP and slot ID of Airespace AP IF along with the currentChannel for this Airespace AP IF

bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPSlotIdTrapVariable %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPChannelNumberTrapVariable %parm[#5]%;

bsnInterferenceEnergyBeforeChannelUpdate %parm[#6]%;

bsnInterferenceEnergyAfterChannelUpdate %parm[#7]%;
event.logmsg: bsnAPCurrentChannelChanged trap received bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable=%parm[#3]% bsnAPSlotIdTrapVariable=%parm[#4]% bsnAPChannelNumberTrapVariable=%parm[#5]% bsnInterferenceEnergyBeforeChannelUpdate=%parm[#6]% bsnInterferenceEnergyAfterChannelUpdate=%parm[#7]%

event.descr:
When Grouping is done, this notification will be sent from the previous Group Leader where grouping algorithm was run. It will have MAC address of the new Group Leader.

bsnRrmDot11aGroupLeaderMacAddr %parm[#3]%;

When Grouping is done, this notification will be sent from the previous Group Leader where grouping algorithm was run. It will have MAC address of the new Group Leader.

bsnRrmDot11bGroupLeaderMacAddr %parm[#3]%;
When configuration is save either from CLI or web interface This trap will be sent to inform NMS to do refresh

Whenever a new Ess (WLAN) is created, this notification will be sent along with EssIndex

bsnDot11EssIndex %parm[#3]%;

Whenever a Ess (WLAN)is deleted, this notification will be sent along with EssIndex

bsnDot11EssIndex %parm[#3]%;
This trap is to indicate that no RADIUS server(s) are responding to authentication requests sent by the RADIUS client within the MWAR device(Switch).

This trap is to inform that client authentication failure has occured at MWAR(Switch). This could be cli/web user, wlan user, or Mac Authorized user. ServiceType will indicate which type of user it is and userName will be cli/web/wlan userName or MacAddress of Mac Authorized User

bsnAuthFailureUserType %parm[#3]%; mgmtUser(1) wlanUser(2) macFilter(3)

bsnAuthFailureUserName %parm[#4]%;

IPsec packets with invalid hashes were found in an inbound ESP SA. The total number of authentication errors accumulated is sent for the specific row of the ipsecSaEspInTable table for the SA; this provides the identity of the SA in which the error occurred. Implementations SHOULD send one trap per SA (within a reasonable time period), rather than sending one trap per packet.

bsnRemoteIPv4Address %parm[#3]%;

bsnIpsecErrorCount %parm[#4]%;

IPsec packets with invalid sequence numbers were found in an inbound ESP SA. The total number of replay errors accumulated is sent for the specific row of the ipsecSaEspInTable table for the SA; this provides the identity of the SA in which the error occurred. Implementations SHOULD send one trap per SA (within a reasonable time period), rather than sending one trap per packet.

bsnRemoteIPv4Address %parm[#3]%;

bsnIpsecErrorCount %parm[#4]%;

A packet with an unknown SPI was detected from the specified peer with the specified SPI using the specified protocol. The destination address of the received packet is specified by ipsecLocalAddress. The value ifIndex may be 0 if this optional linkage is unsupported. If the object ipsecSecurityProtocol has the value for IPcomp, then the ipsecSPI object is the CPI of the packet. Implementations SHOULD send one trap per peer (within a reasonable time period), rather than sending one trap per packet.

bsnRemoteIPv4Address %parm[#3]%;

bsnIpsecSPI %parm[#4]%;

An attempt to negotiate a phase 1 IKE SA failed. The notification counts are also sent as part of the trap, along with the current value of the total negotiation error counters for ISAKMP.

bsnRemoteIPv4Address %parm[#3]%;

bsnRemoteUdpPort %parm[#4]%;

bsnIkeAuthMethod %parm[#5]%;

bsnIkeTotalInitFailures %parm[#6]%;

bsnIkeTotalInitNoResponses %parm[#7]%;

bsnIkeTotalRespFailures %parm[#8]%;

bsnNotifiesSent %parm[#9]%;

bsnNotifiesReceived %parm[#10]%;
event.logmsg: bsnIpsecIkeNegFailure trap received bsnRemoteIPv4Address=%parm[#3]% bsnRemoteUdpPort=%parm[#4]% bsnIkeAuthMethod=%parm[#5]% bsnIkeTotalInitFailures=%parm[#6]% bsnIkeTotalInitNoResponses=%parm[#7]% bsnIkeTotalRespFailures=%parm[#8]% bsnNotifiesSent=%parm[#9]% bsnNotifiesReceived=%parm[#10]%

event.descr:
An attempt to negotiate a phase 2 SA suite for the specified selector failed. The current total failure counts are passed as well as the notification type counts for the notify involved in the failure.

bsnRemoteIPv4Address %parm[#3]%;

bsnSuiteInitFailures %parm[#4]%;

bsnSuiteRespondFailures %parm[#5]%;

bsnNotifiesSent %parm[#6]%;

bsnNotifiesReceived %parm[#7]%;
event.logmsg: bsnIpsecSuiteNegFailure trap received bsnRemoteIPv4Address=%parm[#3]% bsnSuiteInitFailures=%parm[#4]% bsnSuiteRespondFailures=%parm[#5]% bsnNotifiesSent=%parm[#6]% bsnNotifiesReceived=%parm[#7]%

event.descr:
ISAKMP packets with invalid cookies were detected from the specified source, intended for the specified destination. The initiator and responder cookies are also sent with the trap. The current count is sent to allow the trap to accurately relfect dropped and throttled traps. Implementations SHOULD send one trap per peer (within a reasonable time period, rather than sending one trap per packet.

bsnRemoteIPv4Address %parm[#3]%;

bsnRemoteUdpPort %parm[#4]%;

bsnInitiatorCookie %parm[#5]%;

bsnResponderCookie %parm[#6]%;

bsnIsakmpInvalidCookies %parm[#7]%;
event.logmsg: bsnIpsecInvalidCookieTrap trap received bsnRemoteIPv4Address=%parm[#3]% bsnRemoteUdpPort=%parm[#4]% bsnInitiatorCookie=%parm[#5]% bsnResponderCookie=%parm[#6]% bsnIsakmpInvalidCookies=%parm[#7]%

event.descr:
When a Rogue AP is detected this Trap will be sent out along with APMacAddress on which its detected

bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPMacAddress %parm[#4]%;

bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPSlotId %parm[#5]%;

bsnRogueAPSsid %parm[#6]%;

bsnRogueAPChannelNumber %parm[#7]%;

bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPRSSI %parm[#8]%;

bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPSNR %parm[#9]%;

bsnRogueAPOnWiredNetwork %parm[#10]%; no(0) yes(1)

bsnRogueAdhocMode %parm[#11]%; no(0) yes(1)

bsnRogueAPRadioType %parm[#12]%; dot11b(1) dot11a(2) unknown(3)

bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPName %parm[#13]%;
event.logmsg: bsnRogueAPDetected trap received bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPMacAddress=%parm[#4]% bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPSlotId=%parm[#5]% bsnRogueAPSsid=%parm[#6]% bsnRogueAPChannelNumber=%parm[#7]% bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPRSSI=%parm[#8]% bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPSNR=%parm[#9]% bsnRogueAPOnWiredNetwork=%parm[#10]% bsnRogueAdhocMode=%parm[#11]% bsnRogueAPRadioType=%parm[#12]% bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPName=%parm[#13]%

event.descr:
When LOAD Profile state changes from FAIL tp PASS, notification will be sent with Dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP and slot ID of Airespace AP IF. This trap sending can be enable/disable using bsnRrmProfileTrapControlFlag

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

When Noise Profile state changes from FAIL tp PASS, notification will be sent with Dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP and slot ID of Airespace AP IF. This trap sending can be enable/disable using bsnRrmProfileTrapControlFlag

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

When Interference Profile state changes from FAIL tp PASS, notification will be sent with Dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP and slot ID of Airespace AP IF. This trap sending can be enable /disable using bsnRrmProfileTrapControlFlag

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

When Coverage Profile state changes from FAIL tp PASS, notification will be sent with Dot3 MAC address of Airespace AP and slot ID of Airespace AP IF. This trap sending can be enable/disable using bsnRrmProfileTrapControlFlag

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

When a Rogue AP that was detected earlier no longer exists this Trap will be sent out along with APMacAddress on which its detected

bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPMacAddress %parm[#4]%;

bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPSlotId %parm[#5]%;

bsnRogueAPRadioType %parm[#6]%; dot11b(1) dot11a(2) unknown(3)

bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPName %parm[#7]%;
event.logmsg: bsnRogueAPRemoved trap received bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPMacAddress=%parm[#4]% bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPSlotId=%parm[#5]% bsnRogueAPRadioType=%parm[#6]% bsnRogueAPAirespaceAPName=%parm[#7]%

event.descr:
Whenever the currently associated Radios exceed the License Count This trap will be sent to annoy the Customer

bsnCurrentRadiosCount %parm[#3]%;

bsnLicenseRadioCount %parm[#4]%;

temp sensor temp too High -- temp is too high on the unit. Immediate action should be taken

bsnSensorTemperature %parm[#3]%;

temp sensor temp too Low -- temp is too high on the unit. Immediate action should be taken

bsnSensorTemperature %parm[#3]%;
temp sensor hw failure -- temp sensor has failed. Temperature is unknown

temp sensor clear -- temp sensor alarm condition is over. sensor is operating within proper temp range

bsnSensorTemperature %parm[#3]%;
POE Controller has failed. Its a very critical trap. User intervention is required.

The number of rogues has exceeded the maximum Rogues allowed

bsnMaxRogueCount %parm[#3]%;

The number of rogues is within the maximum Rogues allowed

bsnMaxRogueCount %parm[#3]%;

The number of rogues has exceeded the maximum Rogues allowed on the AP

bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable %parm[#3]%;

bsnMaxRogueCount %parm[#4]%;

The number of rogues is within the maximum Rogues allowed on the AP

bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable %parm[#3]%;

bsnMaxRogueCount %parm[#4]%;

The station blacklisted notification shall be sent when the client is blacklisted. The reason could be repeated auth or association failures or IP Address theft. The value of the notification shall include the MAC address of the MAC to which the Authentication frame was sent, the MAC and Slot Id of AP that client was associated to and the reason for black listing.

bsnStationAPMacAddr %parm[#3]%;

bsnStationAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnStationBlacklistingReasonCode %parm[#5]%; failed80211Auth(1) failedAssociation(2) ipTheft(3) failed8021xAuth(4) failedWebAuth(5)

bsnStationMacAddress %parm[#6]%;
event.logmsg: bsnDot11StationBlacklisted trap received bsnStationAPMacAddr=%parm[#3]% bsnStationAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnStationBlacklistingReasonCode=%parm[#5]% bsnStationMacAddress=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
The associate notification shall be sent when any of the watchlisted clients(present on at least one watch list) associates with an AP. The value of the notification shall include the MAC address and the Slot ID of the radio to which the station Associated.

bsnStationAPMacAddr %parm[#3]%;

bsnStationAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnStationMacAddress %parm[#5]%;

bsnStationUserName %parm[#6]%;
event.logmsg: bsnDot11StationAssociate trap received bsnStationAPMacAddr=%parm[#3]% bsnStationAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnStationMacAddress=%parm[#5]% bsnStationUserName=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
The AP sent a string of messages with large NAV field and all 802.11 traffic on that channel was suspended.

bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPSlotIdTrapVariable %parm[#4]%;

bsnNavDosAttackSourceMacAddr %parm[#5]%;

The Management User made too many unsuccessful login attempts.

bsnUserIpAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnStationUserName %parm[#4]%;

Issued when a decrypt error occurrs. The WEP Key configured at the station may be wrong.

bsnStationMacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnStationAPMacAddr %parm[#4]%;

bsnStationAPIfSlotId %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: bsnWepKeyDecryptError trap received bsnStationMacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnStationAPMacAddr=%parm[#4]% bsnStationAPIfSlotId=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
Issued when a WPA MIC error occurs and a counter measure is activated at the AP.

bsnStationMacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnStationAPMacAddr %parm[#4]%;

bsnStationAPIfSlotId %parm[#5]%;

bsnWlanIdTrapVariable %parm[#6]%;
event.logmsg: bsnWpaMicErrorCounterActivated trap received bsnStationMacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnStationAPMacAddr=%parm[#4]% bsnStationAPIfSlotId=%parm[#5]% bsnWlanIdTrapVariable=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
When a Rogue is detected on the wired network this trap will be sent out. The same trap with bsnRogueAPOnWiredNetwork set to no will clear the previous trap.

bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnRogueAPOnWiredNetwork %parm[#4]%; no(0) yes(1)

When an AP has no radio cards present on it, the switch sends this trap.

bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable %parm[#3]%;

This trap is issued when the switch or an AP detects another machine using its IP Address. The first variable has value yes if the duplicate IP is reported by an AP. In that case, the second attribute will carry the AP MAC Address. The third variable is the duplicate IP address in question and the last attribute is the MAC Address of the machine that is found to be using the duplicate IP.

bsnDuplicateIpReportedByAP %parm[#3]%; no(0) yes(1)

bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable %parm[#4]%;

bsnDuplicateIpTrapVariable %parm[#5]%;

bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress %parm[#6]%;

bsnDuplicateIpTrapClear %parm[#7]%; false(0) true(1)
event.logmsg: bsnDuplicateIpAddressReported trap received bsnDuplicateIpReportedByAP=%parm[#3]% bsnAPMacAddrTrapVariable=%parm[#4]% bsnDuplicateIpTrapVariable=%parm[#5]% bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress=%parm[#6]% bsnDuplicateIpTrapClear=%parm[#7]%

event.descr:
When our AP detects that it is being contained by another AP, this trap is issued. The clear flag is true if the AP is no longer being contained.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPIfType %parm[#5]%; dot11b(1) dot11a(2) uwb(4)

bsnClearTrapVariable %parm[#6]%; false(0) true(1)
event.logmsg: bsnAPContainedAsARogue trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnAPIfType=%parm[#5]% bsnClearTrapVariable=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
Issued when a Trusted Rogue AP is auto contained for advertising invalid SSID. If the clear variable has value true, then the trap clears the earlier alert.

bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnClearTrapVariable %parm[#4]%; false(0) true(1)

Issued when a Trusted Rogue AP is missing or has failed. If the clear variable has value true, then the trap clears the earlier alert.

bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnClearTrapVariable %parm[#4]%; false(0) true(1)

Issued when an Adhoc Rogue is auto contained. If the clear variable has value true, then the trap clears the earlier alert.

bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnClearTrapVariable %parm[#4]%; false(0) true(1)

Issued when a Rogue AP is auto contained for advertising our SSID. If the clear variable has value true, then the trap clears the earlier alert.

bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnClearTrapVariable %parm[#4]%; false(0) true(1)

Issued when a Trusted Rogue AP is auto contained for using invalid encryption. The second param is for the encryption used and the third param is for encryption required. If the clear variable has value true, then the trap clears the earlier alert.

bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnTrustedApEncryptionUsed %parm[#4]%; none(0) open(1) wep(2) wpa(3)

bsnTrustedApEncryptionRequired %parm[#5]%; none(0) open(1) wep(2) wpa(3)

bsnClearTrapVariable %parm[#6]%; false(0) true(1)
event.logmsg: bsnTrustedApHasInvalidEncryption trap received bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnTrustedApEncryptionUsed=%parm[#4]% bsnTrustedApEncryptionRequired=%parm[#5]% bsnClearTrapVariable=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
Issued when a Trusted Rogue AP is auto contained for using invalid radio policy. The second param is for the radio policy used and the third param is for radio policy required. If the clear variable has value true, then the trap clears the earlier alert.

bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnTrustedApRadioPolicyUsed %parm[#4]%; none(0) dot11b(1) dot11a(2) dot11bg(3)

bsnTrustedApRadioPolicyRequired %parm[#5]%; none(0) dot11b(1) dot11a(2) dot11bg(3)

bsnClearTrapVariable %parm[#6]%; false(0) true(1)
event.logmsg: bsnTrustedApHasInvalidRadioPolicy trap received bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnTrustedApRadioPolicyUsed=%parm[#4]% bsnTrustedApRadioPolicyRequired=%parm[#5]% bsnClearTrapVariable=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
When the 802.11a or b/g network state is changed this trap is issued.

bsnNetworkType %parm[#3]%; dot11b(1) dot11a(2)

bsnNetworkState %parm[#4]%; disable(0) enable(1)

This trap is sent out when a signature attack is detected by the switch. The standard and custom signatures are predefined on the switch (see bsnSignatureConfig group). The signatures also defines if its detection should be reported. The trap variables bsnSignatureName and bsnSignatureDescription are retrieved from the detected signature definition. Clear Trap Variable is turned on when the signature attack stops. The signature's quiet time configuration speicifes the time after which the clear trap would be sent.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPName %parm[#5]%;

bsnAPIfType %parm[#6]%; dot11b(1) dot11a(2) uwb(4)

bsnSignatureType %parm[#7]%; standard(0) custom(1)

bsnSignatureName %parm[#8]%;

bsnSignatureDescription %parm[#9]%;

bsnClearTrapVariable %parm[#10]%; false(0) true(1)

bsnSignatureAttackPreced %parm[#11]%;

bsnSignatureAttackFrequency %parm[#12]%;

bsnSignatureAttackChannel %parm[#13]%;

bsnSignatureAttackerMacAddress %parm[#14]%;
event.logmsg: bsnSignatureAttackDetected trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnAPName=%parm[#5]% bsnAPIfType=%parm[#6]% bsnSignatureType=%parm[#7]% bsnSignatureName=%parm[#8]% bsnSignatureDescription=%parm[#9]% bsnClearTrapVariable=%parm[#10]% bsnSignatureAttackPreced=%parm[#11]% bsnSignatureAttackFrequency=%parm[#12]% bsnSignatureAttackChannel=%parm[#13]% bsnSignatureAttackerMacAddress=%parm[#14]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent by the switch when a radio card on an AP stops transmitting.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPIfType %parm[#5]%; dot11b(1) dot11a(2) uwb(4)
event.logmsg: bsnAPRadioCardTxFailure trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnAPIfType=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent by the switch when a radio card on an AP starts transmitting again after a prior failure.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPIfType %parm[#5]%; dot11b(1) dot11a(2) uwb(4)
event.logmsg: bsnAPRadioCardTxFailureClear trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnAPIfType=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent by the switch when a radio card on an AP stops receiving.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPIfType %parm[#5]%; dot11b(1) dot11a(2) uwb(4)
event.logmsg: bsnAPRadioCardRxFailure trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnAPIfType=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent by the switch when a radio card on an AP starts receiving again after a prior failure.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPIfType %parm[#5]%; dot11b(1) dot11a(2) uwb(4)
event.logmsg: bsnAPRadioCardRxFailureClear trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnAPIfType=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent by the switch when a radio of an authenticated AP hears from another AP whose MAC Address neither matches that of a rogue's and nor is it an authenticated neighbor of the detecting AP.

bsnImpersonatedAPMacAddr %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#5]%;

bsnAPIfType %parm[#6]%; dot11b(1) dot11a(2) uwb(4)
event.logmsg: bsnAPImpersonationDetected trap received bsnImpersonatedAPMacAddr=%parm[#3]% bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#4]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#5]% bsnAPIfType=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
Issued when a Trusted Rogue AP is auto contained for using invalid preamble. The second param is for the preamble used and the third param is for preamble required. If the clear variable has value true, then the trap clears the earlier alert.

bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnTrustedApPreambleUsed %parm[#4]%; none(0) short(1) long(2)

bsnTrustedApPreambleRequired %parm[#5]%; none(0) short(1) long(2)

bsnClearTrapVariable %parm[#6]%; false(0) true(1)
event.logmsg: bsnTrustedApHasInvalidPreamble trap received bsnRogueAPDot11MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnTrustedApPreambleUsed=%parm[#4]% bsnTrustedApPreambleRequired=%parm[#5]% bsnClearTrapVariable=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent out when an AP, with the configured static ip-address, fails to establish connection with outside world and starts using DHCP as a fallback option.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnApIpAddress %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPStaticIPAddress %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: bsnAPIPAddressFallback trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnApIpAddress=%parm[#4]% bsnAPStaticIPAddress=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent out when AP functionality on the switch is disabled because the License key has expired or has been deleted or doesn't match the switch image.

bsnApFunctionalityDisableReasonCode %parm[#3]%; unknown(0) licenseKeyExpired(1) licenseKeyDeleted(2) licenseKeyFeatureMismatch(3)

bsnLicenseKeyTrapVariable %parm[#4]%;

bsnLicenseKeyFeatureSetTrapVariable %parm[#5]%; wps(1) all(2)

This trap is generated if an AP's regulatory domain doesn't match the country the switch is configured for. Due to the mismatch, the AP will fail to associate with the Switch.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPName %parm[#4]%;

bsnApRegulatoryDomain %parm[#5]%; a(0) e(1) i(6) j(9) c(16) n(21) k(32) p(33) s(34) t(35) r(48) notavailable(65535)

bsnGlobalDot11CountryIndex %parm[#6]%; usa(1) canada(2) france(3) japan(4) mexico(5) spain(6) usalegacy(7) korearepublic(8) australia(9) austria(10) belgium(11) denmark(12) finland(13) germany(14) greece(15) ireland(16) italy(17) luxembourg(18) netherlands(19) portugal(20) sweden(21) unitedkingdom(22) none(23) india(24) hongkong(25) switzerland(26) iceland(27) norway(28) singapore(29) thailand(30) taiwan(31) usanewunii(32) cyprus(33) czechrepublic(34) estonia(35) hungary(36) lithuania(37) latvia(38) malaysia(39) newzealand(40) poland(41) slovenia(42) slovakrepublic(43) southafrica(44) usachan165(45) israel(46) israelOutdoor(47) argentina(48) brazil(49) saudiArabia(51) turkey(52) indonesia(53) china(54) koreaExtended(55) japan2(56)
event.logmsg: bsnAPRegulatoryDomainMismatch trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPName=%parm[#4]% bsnApRegulatoryDomain=%parm[#5]% bsnGlobalDot11CountryIndex=%parm[#6]%

event.descr: This trap indicates that the CPU's Receive Multicast Queue is Full.

This trap is sent when radar signals are detected on the current channel

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPIfPhyChannelNumber %parm[#5]%; ch1(1) ch2(2) ch3(3) ch4(4) ch5(5) ch6(6) ch7(7) ch8(8) ch9(9) ch10(10) ch11(11) ch12(12) ch13(13) ch14(14) ch34(34) ch36(36) ch38(38) ch40(40) ch42(42) ch44(44) ch46(46) ch48(48) ch52(52) ch56(56) ch60(60) ch64(64) ch100(100) ch104(104) ch108(108) ch112(112) ch116(116) ch120(120) ch124(124) ch128(128) ch132(132) ch136(136) ch140(140) ch149(149) ch153(153) ch157(157) ch161(161) ch165(165) ch169(169)
event.logmsg: bsnRadarChannelDetected trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnAPIfPhyChannelNumber=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap will be generated, if a radar trap has been generated earlier, after the expiry of Non-Occupancy Period.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPIfPhyChannelNumber %parm[#5]%; ch1(1) ch2(2) ch3(3) ch4(4) ch5(5) ch6(6) ch7(7) ch8(8) ch9(9) ch10(10) ch11(11) ch12(12) ch13(13) ch14(14) ch34(34) ch36(36) ch38(38) ch40(40) ch42(42) ch44(44) ch46(46) ch48(48) ch52(52) ch56(56) ch60(60) ch64(64) ch100(100) ch104(104) ch108(108) ch112(112) ch116(116) ch120(120) ch124(124) ch128(128) ch132(132) ch136(136) ch140(140) ch149(149) ch153(153) ch157(157) ch161(161) ch165(165) ch169(169)
event.logmsg: bsnRadarChannelCleared trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnAPIfPhyChannelNumber=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent out in case of authorization failure while attempting to associate the AP to the controller. bsnAPDot3MacAddress represents the mac-address of that AP. bsnAPName is name of AP

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPName %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPAuthCertificateType %parm[#5]%; unknown(0) mic(1) ssc(2)

bsnAPAuthorizationFailureCause %parm[#6]%; unknown(0) keymismatch(1) entrydoesnotexist(2) invalidCertifcate(3) entryIsMIC(4)
event.logmsg: bsnAPAuthorizationFailure trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPName=%parm[#4]% bsnAPAuthCertificateType=%parm[#5]% bsnAPAuthorizationFailureCause=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
When radio module in AP dumps core, it informs controller and controller generates this trap. The core file can be retrieved on demand.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

This trap will be generated when an AP has joined is using unsupported radio or a radio slot not currently not being used.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPIfSlotId %parm[#4]%;

bsnAPInvalidRadioType %parm[#5]%; unsupportedRadio(0)
event.logmsg: invalidRadioTrap trap received bsnAPDot3MacAddress=%parm[#3]% bsnAPIfSlotId=%parm[#4]% bsnAPInvalidRadioType=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap will be generated when an operator changes the country of operation. New country code will be sent in trap.

bsnGlobalDot11CountryIndex %parm[#3]%; usa(1) canada(2) france(3) japan(4) mexico(5) spain(6) usalegacy(7) korearepublic(8) australia(9) austria(10) belgium(11) denmark(12) finland(13) germany(14) greece(15) ireland(16) italy(17) luxembourg(18) netherlands(19) portugal(20) sweden(21) unitedkingdom(22) none(23) india(24) hongkong(25) switzerland(26) iceland(27) norway(28) singapore(29) thailand(30) taiwan(31) usanewunii(32) cyprus(33) czechrepublic(34) estonia(35) hungary(36) lithuania(37) latvia(38) malaysia(39) newzealand(40) poland(41) slovenia(42) slovakrepublic(43) southafrica(44) usachan165(45) israel(46) israelOutdoor(47) argentina(48) brazil(49) saudiArabia(51) turkey(52) indonesia(53) china(54) koreaExtended(55) japan2(56)

This trap will be generated when unsupported AP try to join 40xx/410x or 3500 with 64MB flash.

bsnAPDot3MacAddress %parm[#3]%;

bsnAPName %parm[#4]%;
This trap will be generated when controller loses hearbeat with catalyst 6k.

This trap will be generated by the location server for notifications of location events.

locationNotifyContent %parm[#3]%;
